Subject: algorithm to detect noise variance

this isn't NEAT specific, but of potential interest to people working 
with neural nets.

i just attended a fascinating seminar by a Dr. Antonia Jones, on an 
algorithm she calls the Gamma Test. (url: 
http://www.cs.cf.ac.uk/user/Antonia.J.Jones/GammaArchive/IndexPage.htm )

basically it is a way of making a (fast) good guess at what the noise 
variation from a non-linear function in a data set is, without knowing 
what the actual function is.

the main application she made to neural nets is that if you have an idea 
of what the noise variance is you can know when to stop training your 
net to prevent overtraining, thus arriving at a faster, better solution.

another application she made, although not NN specific, is that when 
using this algorithm you can notice potential places of interest in a 
noisy data set, when the specific results in an area don't match the noise.

anyway, enjoy.

-KB-
